quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Tel Aviv and Israel
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, channukah, torah. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the approximate population of Tel Aviv according to the Israel Central Bureau of Statistics as of June 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 380,600

questions.question: What poem written by Chaim Nachman Bialik inspired many people to immigrate to Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The City of the Killings

questions.question: What is the name of the organization that promotes a return to Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jewish Agency

questions.question: What is the name of the Israeli National Theater?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Habima

questions.question: What term is used to describe a persons return to live in Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: aliyah

questions.question: What is the Arabic name for Tel Aviv?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tal al-rabey

questions.question: Which part of Israel is famous fro producing wine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golan Heights

questions.question: Hannukah (or Channukah) is the Jewish equivalent of Christmas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who is given credit  for reviving the Hebrew language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eliezer Ben Yehuda

questions.question: What kind of museum is the Batey Haosef Museum in Tel Aviv?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: military

questions.question: Arthur Loomis Harmon, who helped design the Empire State Building, designed what building in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The YMCA

questions.question: In what language do Ethiopian Jews read Torah?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gez

questions.question: Who was the first mayor of Tel Aviv?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meir Dizengoff

questions.question: What is Israels number one agricultural export?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: flowers

questions.question: What type of stone was used to build the Western or Wailing Wall in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Limestone

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Joan and Arc
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, kind, mishna. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was Joan of Arc accused of at her trial?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heresy

questions.question: In Psalm 23, the Lord is referred to as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Shepherd

questions.question: To what kind of capital punishment was Joan of Arc condemned?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burning at the stake

questions.question: How many books is the Book of Psalms divided into?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Five

questions.question: What is the name of the famous sci-fi author that created Scientology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: L. Ron Hubbard

questions.question: The Book of Psalms is classified as what type of book in the Bible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poetic

questions.question: Where was Joan of Arc captured by Burgundian forces?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Compiegne

questions.question: Who wrote Psalm 23?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David

questions.question: The following lines are from which psalm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Psalm 139

questions.question: What extremely brave attempt to escape did Joan of Arc make while she was imprisoned in Rouen?

options.text: She jumped from the tower where she was held prisoner.
She knocked a guard unconscious and tried to put on his armor and escape.
She pretended she was very sick and then tried to run away.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She jumped from the tower where she was held prisoner.

questions.question: Where in Israel was the Mishna written?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Galilee

questions.question: Joan of Arc lived during the first half of what century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15th century

questions.question: What are Psalms 120 to 134 referred to as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Psalms of Ascent

questions.question: During her testimony at her trial, Joan of Arc stated she preferred which of the following to the sword?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Banner

questions.question: Who was the earliest author of a psalm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moses

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Scientology and Scientologists
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, chodesh, shel. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these celebrities is not a scientologist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

questions.question: What is the name of the evil alien dictator who, according to Scientologists, placed millions of people on earth and killed them, using hydrogen bombs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Xenu

questions.question: What is the term scientologists use to describe an immortal spiritual being?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a thetan

questions.question: What is Yichuss?

options.text: Special honor you get from family members
The special prayer shawl worn by women
A fast day celebrated on the day before Passover
The first book of the Kabbalah

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Special honor you get from family members

questions.question: What is the name of the book, that states points of the scientologic doctrine for the first time?

options.text: Dianetics: The Modern Science of Mental Health

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dianetics: The Modern Science of Mental Health

questions.question: What does Yom Yerusalyim celebrate?

options.text: The building of the Second Temple in Jerusalem
The peace treaty between Egypt and Israel at Camp David
The building of the First Temple by Solomon
The unification of the City of Jerusalem after the Six Days War

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The unification of the City of Jerusalem after the Six Days War

questions.question: What is Yom Sheni shel Galuyot?

options.text: The extra day of observance of  some holidays in the Diaspora
The special prayer shawl worn by men every day
The second Torah read in synagogues on Saturday

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The extra day of observance of  some holidays in the Diaspora

questions.question: What are the two major pronunciations of Hebrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ashkenazi and Sephardeet

questions.question: What do we call the  first written book of the Kabbalah?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zohar

questions.question: In the 1970s, members of The Church of Scientology committed infiltration of United States federal agencies in order to eliminate unfavorable reports on Scientology. What was the code name for the operation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Operation Snow White

questions.question: What is the literal meaning of the word scientology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Study of Knowledge

questions.question: Which of these countries does not recognize Scientology as an official religion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: What is Rosh Chodesh?

options.text: The first book of the Talmud
A fast day  that occurs a day after Rosh Hashanah
The first book of the Torah

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Celebration of the new month

questions.question: What is the term that scientologists use to describe traumatic recordings that cause mental and psychosomatic physical problems?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: engrams

questions.question: What do the eight corners of the Scientology cross symbolize?

options.text: the eight planets orbiting the Sun
the arms of the evil intergalactic emperor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the eight dynamics of life

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Tibet and Tibetan Buddhism
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, tzefardea, genius. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Hebrew term means genius?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: gaon

questions.question: The esoteric tradition known as Tantra originated in Tibet and is unique to Tibetan Buddhism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What does Aygel Hah Zahav refer to?

options.text: Special prayers said at bedtime and and sunrise.
The golden calf built by Aaron.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The golden calf built by Aaron.

questions.question: What are Dam, Tzefardea, Kinim?

options.text: The names of the three major holidays Jews celebrate in September and October
The first three plagues G-D put upon the Egyptians
The three books of the Torah

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first three plagues G-D put upon the Egyptians

questions.question: What is the title of the leader of the Kagyu, one of the four major schools of Tibetan Buddhism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karmapa

questions.question: Who was the founder of the first Tibetan Buddhist Dharma center in the West?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chogyam Trungpa

questions.question: What do we call the language spoken by Jews in Spain and Portugal, which consisted of mainly Spanish and Hebrew  words written in Hebrew letters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ladino

questions.question: What year did the XIVth Dalai Lama escape Tibet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1959

questions.question: What is the name of the Tibetan King who is said to have brought and solidified Buddhism in Tibet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Songtsen Gampo

questions.question: The Hebrew term for the Old Testament is Tanach. How many books are in the Tanach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 24

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the four main forms of Tibetan Buddhism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chan

questions.question: Who is considered the first Chassidic Rabbi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Baal Shem Tov

questions.question: The Potala is traditionally the summer palace of the Dalai Lama in Tibet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which word refers to a Tibetan Buddhist lama or other religious figure, who has consciously decided to be reborn, in order to continue his/her religious pursuits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tulku

questions.question: Who is the second highest lama in the Gelugpa lineage of Tibetan Buddhism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Panchen Lama

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Holy Grail and The Holy Grail
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, dalai, padmasambhava. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In Arthurian legend Percival first saw the Holy Grail in the castle of the Fisher King, who was badly wounded in this part of the body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the groin

questions.question: In the mystery novel The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown the secrets of the Holy Grail are kept by this secret society.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The priory of Sion

questions.question: Percival was the first knight in Arthurian legend to see the Holy Grail in the castle of the Fisher King. He could not heal the King’s wound, though. Why?

options.text: He did not ask the right question.
He was not the chosen one.
He was cursed by The Green Knight.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He did not ask the right question.

questions.question: The Holy Grail was a popular theme in many literary works from the 19th century such as the Arthurian cycle The Idylls of the King. Who was its author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

questions.question: Who wrote Joseph dArimathie, the first literary work to link the Holy Grail with the Last Supper of Jesus and Joseph of Arimathea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert de Boron

questions.question: In the 1991 movie The Fisher King, Robin Williams’ character is obsessed with the legend of the Fisher King and tries to get the Holy Grail. He believes that this object is actually the Grail.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: а sport trophy

questions.question: The Dalai Lama and the Karmapa are believed to be emanations of what deity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chenrenzig

questions.question: At Christmas, Christians celebrates the Nativity or birth of Jesus Christ in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bethlehem

questions.question: Three Knights of the Round Table get to see the Holy Grail. First Percival, then Bors and next who of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galahad

questions.question: The book ‘Holy Blood, Holy Grail’ by Michael Baigent, Richard Leigh, and Henry Lincoln proposes the hypothesis that Jesus and Mary Magdalene were actually married and upon Jesus’ death she fled to France, carrying his child.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Holy Grail is sometimes associated with which magical object in Celtic mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The cauldron of Bran

questions.question: The search for The Holy Grail is one of the central themes in the opera Persifal by this German composer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Wagner

questions.question: Which Christian saint, regarded as the first martyr of Christianity, is commemorated on December 27 or 26?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Stephen

questions.question: The Holy Grail is usually presented as a large beautiful cup or dish. But medieval author Wolfram von Eschenbach claimed in his poem Perzival that the Grail was actually a crown given by God.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Padmasambhava, a widely revered Indian Buddhist master who founded the Tantric school of Buddhism in the 8th century, is known by what other name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guru Rinpoche

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Jew and Right
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, lutheran, land. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which event is regarded as the greatest feast in the Christian calendar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Resurrection of Jesus

questions.question: He was the first Jewish Commodore in the US Navy. He ended the practice of flogging which used to be an accepted form of punishment in the US Navy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uriah Phillip Levy

questions.question: In 1649 he was warned out of trying to settle in Boston.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Solomon Franco

questions.question: This offered Jews full equality in all future US territories and states.

options.text: The Future Farm and Territory Act

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Northwest Territory Act

questions.question: He was the first Jew to serve in a state legislature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Levi Myers

questions.question: In 1665, Abraham de Lucena was arrested and fined for selling goods at retail prices.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The British Plantation Act gave Jews the right to become naturalized citizens with rights to trade within the colonies. In what year was it enacted?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1740

questions.question: This famous pirate, who was a marrano, played a significant role in American history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean Lafitte

questions.question: In 1656 the first Jewish cemetery in the USA was founded in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New  York City, NY

questions.question: The funds to build the first Lutheran church were advanced by a Jew.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This was the first colony to give Jews full political rights.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: He is considered the first Jew on American land to get the right  to serve in a militia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asser Levy

questions.question: He is considered to be the first Jew  to set foot on land that would become part of the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joachim Gaunse

questions.question: On September 8 or September 21, Eastern Orthodox Christians celebrate the birth of this important biblical figure to parents Joachim and Anna.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virgin Mary

questions.question: The Bnai Brit , a well known social welfare organization, was formed to help people who suffered in this American tragedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The great Chicago fire.
